conclusion: Two particles, A and B, are placed on the same horizontal plane and start moving in a straight line simultaneously from rest, from the same position, and in the same direction.
The v-t (velocity-time) graph of their motion is shown in the figure.
Analysis of the motion of A and B: when do A and B meet?
The graph shows two lines representing the velocity of particles A and B over time.
Particle A's velocity increases to 2v0 at t0, decreases to v0 at 2t0, and returns to 0 at 3t0.
Particle B's velocity increases to v0 at t0, remains constant until 4t0, and decreases to 0 at 6t0.

premise: The area enclosed by the v-t graph and the coordinate axes represents displacement.
conclusion: The displacement of a particle can be determined by calculating the area under its velocity-time graph.

premise: When the areas enclosed by the graphs of A and B with the coordinate axes are equal, A and B meet.
conclusion: Particles A and B meet when their displacements are equal.

premise: From the graph, it can be seen that at t=6t0, the displacements of A and B are equal.
conclusion: At t=6t0, particles A and B meet.
